New Records: West Indies batter Nicholas Pooran scored a record-equalling 36 runs off Azmatullah Omarzai’s over in the T20 World Cup match between Afghanistan and West Indies in Gros Islet, Saint Lucia, on June 17, 2024. Pooran surpassed Chris Gayle (124 sixes) as West Indies’ most decorated T20I six-hitter during his innings. He also equaled India’s record set by Yuvraj Singh with six sixes against England in 2007.
Key Match Events: Nicholas Pooran’s brutal assault of 98 runs propelled West Indies to 218/5, their highest first-innings total in the ongoing event and their highest total in the T20 World Cups.
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies notched up the highest first-innings total in the ongoing event and their highest total in the T20 World Cups.
